job_title: Left Blank B in Bloomington, MN
pros: stability  of company. drug coverage on insurance id very good
cons: Salary average,  rest of insurance package is average.job growth does no exist, As a night time worker no perks (shift pay). Lack of staffing requires you to beg coworkers to cover so you can take pto. Call in sick and you are asked to cover your shift by working from home.

review_title: Efficiently run and focused on the bottom line ( not employee centric )
pros: The company has grown rapidly through acquisitions and has been successful, and it is a key player in the healthcare PBM (pharmacy benefit management) space.  As a result, you have a chance to do work for clients that include many giants of American industry and government organizations.
cons: You must work in the St Louis, Missouri headquarters to have good long term job prospects.  Also, because of the frequent consolidations, it is hard to predict job stability.

review_title: Overworked staff...unable to always keep promises that are made.
pros: Decent work/life balance.  Company does allow telecommuting.  Number of days depends on the department.
cons: Many positions recently moved to exempt (salaried).  Not always a bad thing, but during 4th quarter, many departments have a requirement of 15+hours of overtime weekly.  This may range from September through late January.  The wages have not adjusted to accommodate that demand.  There have also been periods of layoffs due to recent merger with Medco.

pros: I have absolutely no pros for this company.  They do not value their employees one bit. Steer clear of working for this company.
cons: They will suck the life out of you. You will work your rear off doing task that are nearly impossible to get finished on time and work 3 people's jobs while others spend the day sucking up only to end up having your job outsourced.  Btw. Then you will be asked to train your replacement.

job_title: Senior Intervention Technician in Tempe, AZ
pros: Great Benefits, Large company with ability to transfer.
cons: This is the epicenter of corporate American politics. Incompetent people are promoted within into management position. Process improvement ideas and initiatives are taken from you and implemented and the creator gets none of the credit they are due. I was fired for for serving jury duty. Expect my lawsuit.

review_title: Great team, but problems with company as a whole
pros: I had a great team with great senior management who did not worry about micro managing and gave you some space.
cons: Ever since the merger, things have gotten very political and the cost cutting has forced good people out of the company.

review_title: Don't Do It Unless You're Desperate!
pros: It's a job.  The health benefits for pharmacists are very good. This is a union site.  All other benefits are average.  No real perks.
cons: Pay is average.  There is no personal growth; instead there is a marked personal decline. Many employees have resorted to taking antidepressants just to make it through the day.  Training is provided for new duties of the job, but not to improve the employees' overall skills.  Cut-throat environment;  job loss is a constant threat. Anyone who complains to upper management gets a target on their back. Pharmacists are forced to review prescriptions so fast, it is not safe for the patients. Most leave due to fear of harming the patients and because they are afraid they will lose their license due to a mistake.  Very stressful, and at the same time very boring and sedentary work.  Many carpal tunnel syndrome and neuralgia problems from sitting in the same chair all day long, with two 15 minute breaks and 30 minutes for lunch.  Lots of eye problems and headaches from computer screens.  No job satisfaction.  Not a good idea unless you can't find anyplace else to work.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Phoenix, AZ
pros: They are fairly easy to work with your schedule if you need time off.
cons: Very clicky, and they tell you can move up easily but they only seem to promote you if you get in their click. So many system issues and no one seems to care to actually resolve the issue. There are other companies that do the same thing but pay way much more.

pros: 20+ days paid vacation per year, relatively up-to-date equipment, decent chances for promotion and career advancement, management is at the very least friendly and approachable.
cons: Constant confusion among management regarding new procedures, lax hiring standards, lack of pay increases, somewhat frequent threats of site closure over performance issues, unexpected and odd banning of food and drinks in office.

job_title: Pharmacy Tech-Trend in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Employment, convenient cafeteria, good people to work with, good benefits.
cons: Pay, inability to move up even with a couple of degrees, HR is ineffective with communication, pay raises is a joke, they put the work scale so high that it is unreachable to give a pay raise

review_title: Save yourself the hassle and don't work here.
job_title: Data Entry Pharmacy Technician in Troy, NY
pros: My co-workers make the job. Everything else about it is horrible.
cons:
They care to much about meeting numbers and not enough about happy employees. There are plenty of days were I feel like I can't even use the restroom because I'll fail to meet their goal of shrinkage. Pay is terrible. 

Tired of being walked all over

pros: Great pay, benefits and bones. Flexible work time, can work from home.
cons: Extremely disorganized department, top heavy management, poor work/ life balance, little to no direction, awful on boarding process, little to no guidance regarding development, very high turnover, the department "right-sized" less than two months after upper management stated they would retain the talent they had currently.

pros: work-place is clean and climate controlled
cons: No one is in charge, only silos to an unreachable end.   Decisions are either not made or last minute without consultation.

review_title: Great company with many opportunities for advancement
pros: Very generous health benefits, tuition reimbursement, 401k match. At the management level there are team building offsite events and many opportunities to win prizes (trips, electronics, etc.)
cons: During 2013 we have been working on a major upgrade and merger. Due to this some departments have had to work extended hours and more hectic schedules. However, this is to be expected from any company experiencing rapid growth.

review_title: I wouldn't recommend this company to anyone
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Excellent benefits and that's it
cons: Stressful work environment, unrealistic metrics, opportunity for advancements or being hired in another department is given to friends, quality monitoring our calls are harsh with scoring them even if caller satisfied, always having system errors and failing and we are not able to handle calls sufficiently, and the scheduling system is not accurate which HR is aware of but they continue to have us use it which creates conflict in the pointing system for our attendence. Bottom line I tried hard everyday to find another job!!!!

review_title: Intense work environment.  Compensation is very competitive.  Work life balance is non-existent. Benefits are adequate
pros: Ample opportunity to move within company; vertically, laterally.  Very intelligent, driven employees.  Pays well.  Fast pace environment.  The benefits are decent as well.
cons: Fast pace environment.  Not afraid to overwork employees and replace those who burn out.  Very intense work ethic, combined with little life-work balance.

job_title: Registered Pharmacist in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Work schedule, no holidays, no Sundays
cons: The required mandatory time off weekly. Their bottom line was how many Rx could be filled in an hour (numbers) & those numbers increases monthly. Patient safety did not seem important. Same drug class meds were filled without calling patient or doctors, even if the doctors were different. Supervisor structure was a joke. They had supervisors over pharmacist who had no pharmacy background. They wanted to be a first class number 1 pharmacy and they had to buy Medco in order to become #1.

pros: No pros.  Other than a check weekly that cleared.  They treat their employees like garbage. Very unprofessional environment.  Lazy supervisors that sat behind their desks reprimanding people for asking a question.
cons:
1. Unprofessional people
2.  Throw others under the bus culture
3.  "Worst place to work" it was voted in 2015
4. Slow computers
5. Working in BCR, questionable practices no integrity
6. Don't be fooled by positive reviews ESI is trying to save face due to being on the worst places to work list
7. Constant fear of layoffs

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Pay was good. Original boss was good.
cons: Changed bosses 7 times in one year. Differentiation for annual reviews meant I had to fire a good employee. The hours are terrible-- at least 70/week. No time to do your job when all day was spent in meetings

pros: This company really cares about their employees! They make sure you have everything you need to be successful at your job. They also have great benefits.
cons: There is so much you need to learn before you can do your job, but once you are done training it will come naturally.

review_title: Company Culture is On the Rise
pros:
PTO Benefits are great
401k match is great
After several years of consolidation and integration, the company has transitioned back into a growth strategy and are taking steps to improve culture and make ESI a better place to work
cons:
Medical benefit costs and coverages have gotten worse
Technology is a little bit behind and reactive versus proactive
Work/Life balance has improved, but could still use some work

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Dublin, OH
pros: Decent benefits, clear expectations, respectful supervisors. Coworkers were friendly, casual environment.  Some work at home opportunities, annual reviews, good communication from supervisors.
cons: Call center. Can be very boring. As well as many many upset customers due to the nature of being a pharmacy benefit manager.

pros: Salary, benefits, teamwork, great leadership, kept everyone informed of FDA guidelines & updates. Leadership always kept us informed of latest regulations & drugs. Awesome colleagues always willing to jump in to assist and get the job done!
cons: Attendance is on a point system which is a huge drawback. Point system is based on if one goes to lunch/ break late even if one is busy working.

pros: Great Benefits, good working atmosphere between departments.
cons: Very stressful always demanding, no yearly bonus as they said all this years I received just one, pay is no bad but is no good either, no motivation from the manager when you do a good work just complaining when you make an small mistake.

review_title: Lots of change, lots of stress, in the home stretch...
pros: Competitive environment that promotes from within.  Merging of two PBMs getting done quickly. Patient focused, client focused but struggling due to integration. If you enjoy challenging work this is a good place to work.
cons: Integration growing pains. Stress levels at an all time high. Losing some top people due to being over worked.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Dublin, OH
pros: You can feel good about reviewing insurance benefits, and you help members learn how to make benefits work for them and get the best discounts.
cons: The company has begun to focus on statistics alone rather than 1 call resolution. This seems to be causing disgruntled members and thus increasing call time which is the standard upon which you will be rated. Work at home positions have been virtually eliminated.

pros: The people are nice and seem to care.  The cafetria selections is pretty good too.  If assigned to the right project the work can be very interesting.
cons: Constant re-orgs and changing managment (CFO left afer less than a year on the job - what did she know?)  Folks outside of St. Louis live under the shadow of 'the next round of layoffs.'  You'll be penalized if you decide to take their benefits and your partner/spouse has benefits from their work.

review_title: Customer Focus, where has it gone!?
pros: People are great, able to travel and see different areas of the business. HR was often a good outlet when issues arose. Immediate Supervisor was great to work for.
cons: Not enough focus on the customer or employee moral. Holiday parties or any employee celebration  was null and void. Recognition was laking for Leaders and employees.

pros: Management appears to really want to change the companies image and provide better work life balance.
cons: In house information technology is reached a point where they cant resolve small in house problems efficiently and information systems are so complex the company has difficulty assessing impacts of changing environment. The company does not push authority to lower levels of management which requires VP approval to get anything accomplished.

pros: PTO, 401-K match is awesome.
cons: No work/life balance. there is not equal treatment. favoritism. career opportunities are slim sometimes.

review_title: Last place on earth to work
job_title: IT Program Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The only reason to work here is the pay. They know how bad they are and that they have to pay above market to get anyone to work here.
cons: Poor HR department and policies.  Disjointed management guidance. Long work hours with no compensation. Poor promotion opportunities - plan on doing, forever, the job you were hired for.

review_title: If you have a family this is not somewhere you would want to be
pros:
Great healthcare
There is nothing else really positive to say about the place. Working there really felt like a slave ship.
cons:
Random/mandatory OT
Negative environment 
Constant harassment 
Slander
Supervisors turn blind eye to wrong doings
I could go on all day about this place . They have a VERY high turnover rate they are literally higher if ppl every 2weeks because of how they treat us there.  If you're okay with being walked over and followed everywhere then you will be a great fit . If not this is not the place for you . I repeat , THIS IS NOT the place for you

job_title: Senior Business Systems Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Retirement benefits (401k, ESPP) are solid and PTO is several weeks.  After several years of upheaval trying to integrate with Medco, the company took a turn for the better with new C suite leadership a couple of years ago.  Much more effort being made to listen to employees, and to make meaningful changes.
cons: Work life balance can be a struggle if you let it.  There are careers development programs in place, but very little movement actually occurring internally.

review_title: good company  - not too good IT
job_title: Software Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: latest technology, great technical team to work with, good PMs, mule, spring, hibernate, rule engine, and many other latest technology to work with
cons: bad leadership, off shore team is screing up the work place. no stability for contractors. no budget control. fire people just for 1-2 week funding gap.

review_title: If you enjoy being respected and challenged, don't work here
pros: compensation and benefits are competitive
cons: Senior Leadership is on a downward spiral. The company is run by about 20 people who are not open to taking good advice. They have no strategy for the future and the company does not respect their employees. Systems are archaic and jobs are mundane.

review_title: Still sorting itself out in the wake of the massive merger and healthcare reform
pros: Dynamic company that stays ahead of industry trends. Employs lots of smart, knowledgeable people within the industry. They do solicit feedback from employees.
cons: Lots of disorganization within mid-level management - particular on the IT side. People are often have "silowed" responsibilities, so it's often tough to find support or the right person for assistance. Sloppy training/preparation of integrating employees.

pros:
- very good salary and benefits
- high potential if management is changed and true leaders are brought on
cons:
- when you compare your salary with how many hours you actually work (versus what's written in the contract), it doesn't look so good anymore
- no work/life balance
- ineffective processes
- management is incapable of making quick decisions, and/or change their mind on a daily basis
- lack of accountability
- new processes are not assessed for impact on all stakeholders,
- lack of employee support from their manager
- lack of resources to execute on the approved projects
- reactive organization
- and so many more

review_title: Out with the old, in with the worst
pros: There are no pros in working for Express Scripts.  They don't promote from within, they change procedure without testing first, and they don't care about employee health or well benefit.
cons: Hard work not rewarded.  Vacation and PTO time must be earned each week.  Favoritism used in promoting employees.  Impossible to get anything other than the "std raise" at annual review.

review_title: It's been horrible working here ever since express script took over medco.
pros: The only thing good I can say is that they have not lowered our pay yet, and I think thats because the ESI that I work at is still covered by a union, at least until our contract expires. but on the other hand we will not get a raise either.
cons: This is the cheapest co. I ever worked for they don't give us anything not even a christmas card no raises, working like slaves, no sitting unless your on break or lunch, no room for advancement,  lots of favoritism. Can't wait to leave.

review_title: Earned there spot as being the worst company to work for
pros:
Good people to work
With - but all trying to
Move
On
cons: Management is horrible. I was under a manager that had no experience having a team. Was nothing but a terror and very disrespectful to everyone. He should have stayed on a cubicle crunching numbers. Having reported to him makes me have no respect for this company.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Marys, GA
pros: Cheap Healthcare and Performance bonuses. Set Schedule.
cons: Management does not care about their employees whatsoever. They do not give you the proper tools to handle disgruntled customers, and there a lot of them. You have to sit there and be abused verbally by a customer with no way to really appease them.

review_title: Low pay, supervisors know nothing but numbers
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Orlando, FL
pros: They VP seemed to be making changes in the right direction of doing more for the clients and caring about the employees. Benefits were great!
cons: Low pay compared to competition, supervisors aren't knowledgeable in your job so you're treated like a number. Advancement opportunities are slim to none.

pros: You get paid.  They paint the walls of the pharmacy a lovely collection of bold bright colors for your visual pleasure when you have a second to look away from your computer
cons: Numbers numbers numbers.  You better work fast and accurately.  Make that ceo his bonus or else!

job_title: Senior Pharmacy Technician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great Benefits, and Pay is not too bad. Location is easy to get to on the bus or train.  Some of the people are easy to work with.
cons: They want perfectionists. You have to be perfect . No matter how good you work one mistake can cost you your raise and bonus. Believe me you can find better than this place.

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Nothing has changed with ESI. They still do not value its employees and employers do not believe in the company. Multiple issues with utilizing overseas team who continue to make errors. They are pushing for managers to write good reviews so they can ensue it shoes improvement and in hopes of a bonus
cons: Everything. This is the worst managed company. Leadership is non existent. They continue to do re work due to mistakes made by the overseas team who they pay overtime. Sad for everyone that works here. Everyone is looking for a new job.

job_title: Scrum Master in Dana Point, CA
pros:
Our company is passionately engaged in transforming theculture into an employee-centric one that supplies cutting-edge, user-driven technology, all for a purpose- getting medication to people easier, faster, and cheaper.
Also, there is a unique ability to move sideways here--you can change roles easier than I've seen anywhere else.
cons: The transformation is ongoing, so some old ways remain in parts.  However, the company is driving to empower employees to push for positive change when they discover this.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Dana Point, CA
pros: The pay and benefits were beneficial. Liked the idea of being moved around throughout the day every 2 hours working a different job to where you're not bored doing the same thing repetitively. Like the OT but....
cons: You weren't given a choice on what shift you wanted to work. There was mandatory OT from the first day on the job.  One of the jobs I did for two hours ruined my back. HR made it seem like I caused that myself. So because of that issue, I left after a couple of months. Not worth the hassle.

pros: Every since the merger with Medco, with whom I was employed, I've been impressed by Express Scripts focus on the employees.  Lean management is an excellent method that I have come to adore.
cons: The merger has been a little rough and uncertain, but really, that's to be expected.  A little more communication would be nice, but it's better than it was with Medco.

review_title: Fine if you are inexperienced and don't know any better
pros: Still employed, but keeping my eyes open
cons: Management coming in from ESI needs to work on their people skills. They boast as if they know all and yet they demonstrate that they know very little about effectively running a business. It all starts with the lower tier; the are the foundation of the business. Once they stop treating their employees like slaves, morale should improve. After working for 3 major corporations before ESI, I can honestly state that it has never been a worse time to not be retired.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Being able to help people receive life saving medication
cons: listening to customer after customer call to complain that their loved one is about to die because that person did not get the medication on time due to not being able to pay thousands of dollars for meds or human error... I hated it! Your calls are always on a 3 minute timer taking calls fast is the main priority NOT CUSTOMER SERVICE

review_title: Worst company I have worked for in the last 20 years
pros: Ability to work from home.
cons: This company touts a work/life balance. Untrue, there is absolutely no balance.  It has returned to archaic business practices of abusing its best resources, people.  The amount of time put in over and above 40 hours is staggering.  When it comes to salary and overtime, you do the math, it is not encouraging.  No support or leadership from upper management.  Rush to get the projects done and deal with the fallout later.  Just an apathetic environment.  Churn and burn mentality.

pros: PTO and bonuses when they are given in full.
cons:
Medical, dental, poor leadership, unrealistic expectations, no work life balance:

There are very few good leaders within this organization. Many members of middle management lead by bullying and being overly critical instead of being motivating and solutions driven. There are individuals in leadership roles that have little to no knowledge of the roles and responsibilities of the departments they are overseeing, so when they are asked for direction, you are simply told to ask others or made to feel like you should already have the answers. There is little to no training. Senior and Executive leadership are clueless and don't seem to care about what is happening at the lower levels.

Morale is extremely low within this organization. Not many people are happy. There is little diversity and the company's focus is strictly their bottom line. Quantity is promoted over quality. Human Resources could care less about any complaints made about leadership. 

Every employee is dispensable and as soon as they no longer need you, they will not hesitate to let you go. 

There is absolutely zero work life balance. You are expected to work days, nights, weekends, and holiday's if that's what it takes to keep your head above water. Even if you are going above and beyond, it will never be good enough and will not be appreciated. 

This is absolutely not a good place to work. It is a very negative and sometimes hostile environment. It is emotionally and physically draining. If you have other employment options, I highly recommend avoiding this organization. Do your research and it will speak for itself.

pros: Good benefits, that's about it.
cons: They preach family/life balance, but it never comes into play.  The pharmacy and warehouse are understaffed and overworked. There is no communication between management and hourly employees, and no communication between departments. ESI makes a decision but has no idea how they will get there. (hint: Oracle) The almighty dollar is all they look at.  I feel sorry for our customers.

review_title: Once Upon a Time a great place to work...
pros: The people, PTO, health insurance, 401K and ESSP
cons: Leadership has lost their way...

job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: IN THE PAST, Express Scripts had a bright outlook for its employees, with huge opportunity to move up the ladder, understanding and responsive leadership, and fair review standards.
cons: Today, many of the seasoned employees within the company, including myself, have been let go due to re-organization or they have left due to the overwhelming workload and lack of leadership.

pros: If you want a job with good benefits and good people this is the place
cons: If your looking for growth and advancement then look eles where. This company pretends to care about it's employees and there development but they don't promote with in or train well

job_title: Testing Ops Analyst I in Saint Louis, MO
pros: People are nice and friendly.  Willing to help and train you.
cons: Management really does not supervise employed so therefore cannot really know the level of experience a employee may have.  Write your own evals which management destroys and writes negative they make up to keep you from salary increase or promotion.  Holiday time is non existent!!!

review_title: It started off really well. After they began closing down sites, it went downward.
job_title: Data Entry Pharmacy Technician in Mason, OH
pros: Great Supervisors, staff friendliness, able to interact with upper management, tuition reimbursement, health insurance, security, overall great environment to work in
cons: VTO (often time is spent just sitting because there is no work to do), low work volume, schedule flexibility, promotion opportunities are limited depending on where you start,

pros: Helping people with prescription drug coverage issues.
cons: No vacation other than Paid Time Off, which is very hard to accumulate. Absences are difficult to report and frowned upon, even sickness. Very, very stressful work with more and more responsibility placed on the workers. Becoming more of a production-oriented call center environment.

review_title: Great opportunities if you're willing to put in the effort
pros:
Promotions available if you have the drive but not the qualifications, they'll help you learn 
I had wonderful upper management who were encouraging and supportive 
Often overtime is available if you're an hourly employee 
Benefits package is excellent 
Work-from-home available for many positions
cons:
Not great about work-life balance, expectations for hours worked are high, especially for salaried employees 
Pay can be on the low side compared to similar positions with other employers

pros: Health care benefits are pretty good.
cons: There is no fairness across the board. Rules change from one person to another. Sups will not work with you even in times of crisis and HR is no better.  Long term employees are treated especially bad so only work here long enough to get some experience and MOVE ON!!

pros: I enjoyed the fact that I was helping customers. That my immediate supervisor was willing to listen to my ideas for change.
cons: No communicain between floor staff and management. Not honest with staff. One day everyone reeived an email. Peope were told to go to  one of two places. Those that were told to go to one place was informed that they had been laid off effective immediately and that supervisor were packing their desk for them.

review_title: The work environment is very uncertain, depressing, and chaotic.
pros: The projects are never dull or boring. There is a wide range of skills and technology.
cons: The changes made by upper management created an atmosphere of chaos and confusion. The managers did a poor job of communicating company changes and policies. People didn’t know what they would be working on—it would change from day to day. Jobs were lost due to outsourcing. People started leaving for of other jobs for fear they would be laid off by the end of the year.

review_title: It seemed like no one was ever on the same page,
pros: Monday-Friday. (sometimes). Cafeteria had good food.
cons: My hours always changed. The auditing of calls was very subjective. The supervisors were always micro managing. If you were on a call too long they would come to your desk and ask why. They were really strict on reaching your metrics. Really hard to take person time off. Very high turn-over in the call center. No associate appreciation incentives. This company was all about numbers numbers numbers….No real care about employees just meeting their goals. Mandatory overtime was always assigned, even 1-2 hours before the end of your shift and if you didn't stay you would get attendance points.

review_title: If you don't have any choices...
pros: Learn a lot.  Lots of opportunity to stretch your skill set. Never boring.
cons: Nobody cares about the people who get the work done. Because of forced ranking it's a race to the middle. Every meeting feels like you are interviewing for your job.  More responsibility comes with no more pay or resources.  Inappropriate and unprofessional behavior tolerated.

pros: Great pay.  Good benefits.
cons:
I was brought onboard with 10+ years experience in a certain IT role and my position was described as a system architect -- I was advised that the company was in the middle of a big relocation effort and I would be integral in planning this move as well as policy implementation moving forward.  I was also told that working remotely would not be an issue as the rest of my team was located halfway across the country and I'd be the only person on my team in my office. I was really excited to bring my skill set to the table and begin work, which lasted for about a week.

I've been at Express Scripts for approximately three months now, and still have not been provided the system access required for me to do my job.  Nobody can explain why it has not transpired and it greatly inhibits my ability to work, there has been a ticket requesting this access in since before I started in July.  There is no real training, when members of my team had time they'd conference me in and let me watch them do certain tasks at which point I was expected to understand the process.  There is no centralized documentation and every single department fights with other departments that need to get along in order to move forward.  Express Scripts is an enormous, poorly-engineered Rube Goldberg machine that ends up throwing marbles all over the floor.

Management is a joke, my hiring manager who made all of the promises to me was unceremoniously moved to an other team within a month of me being at the company and now our team is managed by some exec who is remote to not only me, but all the rest of my team as well and has not so much as introduced himself since becoming our manager.  He has no idea how any of the process for my department works, I don't know what management really DOES, but it seems like a terrible idea to replace the experienced manager with some faceless exec a few weeks into bringing on three new team members who are not trained whatsoever.

Long story short, I have been absolutely miserable every single day since a week into my employment.  The pay is absolutely not worth it, the company is completely mismanaged and I have no idea how they manage to stay in the Fortune 20 other than the fact that healthcare as an industry is completely screwed.

Beware.

review_title: Not bad but not the best either.
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Pueblo, CO
pros: The benefits are good, the people are nice. The stress is remarkably low for a call center job. There are advancement opportunities on a consistent basis. There are not too many shift bids, which means you get to stay in one shift for as long as you like and there aren't too many manager changes which allows you to create a good working relationship with a manager for an extended period of time.
cons: The pay. I hate to say it but it does not pay what it should for the type of work.

pros: New leadership setting a course that focuses on empowerment and encouragement.  Greater focus on innovation and risk taking.
cons: Message of new leadership needs to be embraced by all levels of the organization.

job_title: Senior Pharmacy Technician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I love working for express scripts. .Team work and advancement and you can move up in a career if you really apply yourself. .i started off as a pharmacy tech..now I am a cell owner senior tech..I do S.O.P.S .Train new Employees work well with my lead.
cons: I really dont have no downsides my 5 five yearswith express scripts been great. Just need sick days.

pros: Express scripts is working every day to be more employee friendly and making sure employees feel appreciated and valued.
cons: It's a large company so some roles can really begin to feel like you're just a number and it's hard to get noticed.  It gets better though!

pros: Tuition reimbursement, Overtime, Paid weekly
cons: This company has got to be one of the worst companies to work for. They do not care about their employees at all. They are concerned with the c/o rate and suggests ways to prevent from calling out but then when you try and use those options they deny it. They promote people within the business based on how well they know you and not on your qualifications. They have ridiculous expectations. The turn over rate is crazy b/c people do not want to work for a company that does not value them. They see us as just a number and not people.

review_title: low pay, management is rude, not  etchial
job_title: Auditor PI in Saint Louis, MO
pros: one week pay vacation and nothing morey
cons: there allot of pressure to get things done in the pharmacy audit dept, especially now that esi need more money to fund its new mail order pbm in Vegas. i have beed told to  find any new revenue by any means, even if we have to destroy pharmacy prescriptions. am going to take this to the news

job_title: Vice President in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great stock options for performers in senior management roles. They don't hesitate to promote the best of the best.  George Paz is a good leader, and down to earth.
cons: Little work/life balance; requires many hours. Be prepared to spend a great deal of time in meetings. With growth as aggressive as it has been, it is often challenging to integrate other business processes before the next, new integration need is upon you. Good problem to have to promote growth though. Just need to have competent people in key positions.

pros: I work with a dedicated bunch of people.  We get the job done, and I can always count on  my coworkers to help out when things get backed up.
cons: Things have been ver turbulent lately.  With the purchase fo two different companies in as many years, things are not smooth.  You will end up working a lot to stay afloat.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Medco was a good company with good core values, but sold out to Express Scripts which never had a reputation as a good place to work. Good employees, wonderful clients, nice systems.
cons: Express does not value employees or clients, the merger is supposed to save a billion dollars. It's cut a thousand jobs so far.They bought the competition, so there's no drive to improve. They have tossed out top talent - well trained professional people and are looking for new cheap and cheerful interns.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grove City, OH
pros: I liked people i worked with. But, i did not like the management that took over about 2012. they changed the rules as they went along to suite them
cons: I was harassed, made fun of , discriminated against, based on age , health , gender, disability. No raises or appreciation. Upper management did not care how lower management treated people. I felt uncomfortable in the work environment.

pros: If you work at the headquarters in St. Louis, there is opportunity to move up and around in the company.  Turnover is extremely high and tenure is low even at the VP level so there are always vacancies.
cons:
Outside of the headquarters, jobs are limited and remote/virtual opportunities are limited.  Express Scripts' unofficial policy has been to hire outside the company to get the skills that they need for any given position instead of promoting and developing existing employees.  

Recent employee survey results were so bad that management would not publish the results.  Lack of opportunities and training was one of the top complaints according to Senior Management's review of the survey.  Other concerns included poor pay and poor work-life balance.  Express Scripts has certainly earned their place as the 2nd worst company to work for in the US.

Recent (2014) customer feedback from physicians, patients, drug manufacturers and insurance providers has also been extremely negative which is a reflection/result of the cutthroat, efficiency driven culture that the CEO George Paz has developed at Express Scripts and forced upon the newly acquired Medco Health Services.

review_title: Grown way too big and imploding
pros:
Bonus is great and many people give this as a pro.  However, the company must perform in order for these to be paid out.   There was a '0' year a few years back.   Not a great bonus then.

One of the few companies that I have worked at where the mission statement actually meant something and the company lived by it.  That has faded since the Medco acquisition but I expect it will come back.
cons:
Countless con's.   Like i said, the bonus is great - but the company wants you to believe that the pay is above what other companies are paying and the bonus gets you out of the league.  I drank that Kool-Aid for years and then went out found a job with a hire base and a gazillion other perks including a very competitive bonus structure.   

They dysfunction has grown since the acquisition.  Employee surveys were taken and there has been no action taken to correct problems.   Leadership was focused on cost cutting and sent many jobs overseas.  Now they don't know why they don't have any SME's left.

HR is powerless and inept.  The calibration system sucks but I still believe in the principles.  It's just that nobody has the desire to make it consistent and fair.   It is truly a popularity contest when it should be about the work you produce.   I've been in those discussions, and have witnessed the politics at play.   This is about somebody's career, not how well they talked about the stuff they weren't delivering.   Talk is cheap and the company rewards those that spin, not those that do because the leaders don't want to take the time to really dig in figure out who is doing the actual work and who is only talking about it.

job_title: Data Entry Pharmacy Technician in Albuquerque, NM
pros: You can become a Certified Pharmacy Technician within a year of being employed. The hours are great if you want Banker's hours. The position I held was very easy. Pay was about right for the job. Time-off is satisfying.
cons: Not much room for advancement. Can become very repetitive and mundane. Sometimes will watch you work over your back to make sure you are following procedure to help prevent errors. This can be both pro and con.

review_title: Express Script doesn't really care about there empoyees or there customers.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Dublin, OH
pros: The Cafe food was okay added i only got a 30 min lunch. Medco had better morals then the new name  Express Scripts, they are really only about trying to save money by hiring temp employees and providing bad customer service. If you are looking for a 90 prescription company go with CVS.
cons: I literally seen people that worked for the company for 15+ years offered severance checks and asked to leave or they wouldn't receive another pay rise at the company, just to hire in temp employees and lie and offer them a permeant job

job_title: Prior Authorization in Liberty Lake, WA
pros: The people you work with are awesome people, they try to treat you like family
cons: Working more quickly, and changes happen a lot due to rules changes but depending on who you ask you will get a different answer

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Pueblo, CO
pros: Earned time off is okay and the benefits are acceptable.
cons: Equipment issues and the company has grown too fast to keep up with demand.  Lousy, lousy raises given annually and the bonus program is always changing to cheat you.  You never really feel like you are doing a good job.  Just trying to get them off the phone, very frustrating and sad.  This is without a doubt the worse job to that I have ever had.

pros: Good pay, strong growth company, fast-pace
cons: Company culture is suffering tremendously, minimal work-life balance, low focus on employee well-being.

pros: 401k match at 6% --- hard to beat that
cons:
1) Turnover and layoffs are very common...1 or 2 every 3 years. The last RIF happened in September where they let go 35+ RMG individuals. No one had a clue...they like to run very lean.

2) If you want to get promoted then you need to live in St. Louis and be at their HQ. Very limited job opportunities otherwise.

3) Work-at-home options are very limited and not really promoted.

pros:
Solid company from a financial perspective. Job
security due to company's standing and amount of 
position types available.
cons:
Company is top heavy and generally only pays managers and above
fair or above market value. Pay rates are generally lower than geographic
standards for like positions.

pros: Express Scripts has great core values and strives to live by them, namely: Integrity, Service, Passion, Motivation, Innovation. It was a good corporate culture.
cons: As is the case in all companies that I've worked for, there are good people leaders and there are some  that leave you scratching your asking how they got to that position.

review_title: Hiring freeze and no hope for help.
pros:
It used to be a positive work environment with capable management.
they have a cafe on site, and they are a smoke free facility.
cons: The Whitestown, Indiana  location is very racist, there isn't room for growth and nepotism is alive and well.

job_title: Patient Service Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I worked in the Call Center and loved every moment of it. Great Working Environment. Good Communication between co workers, and management.  Great benefits.
cons: There really are't any cons i can think of.

review_title: Good until they dont need you or you get under bad manager and/or hr combo and they slay your career
job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good company overall. I started out in call center working pt and worked my way up.
cons: As much as this company excells in business community, they have failed to earn the respect of there employees and will never be voted best place to work in STL.

review_title: Manage various areas of the pharmacy.
pros: Paid time off is generous.  401K and other benefits are good.  Company is growing in a market where companies are closing and downsizing.
cons: Work/Life balance is very poor.  Associates are expected to work many hours of overtime.  People are doing the work of multiple positions.  The company grows but does not want to hire at the appropriate rate, rather they put too much pressure on employees to take on additional work.

job_title: Staff Pharmacist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The people I work with are great, not the managers but the workers. When Express Scripts first started out they were great. No night shits or holidays. Had to take a 35% cut in pay but it was worth it to get that time off and have some what of a normal life.
cons: George Paz has lost contact with the employees as the company grew. This week the new schedules were released for the Pharmacists. Most shifts now start a 1:30 in the afternoon and don't end till 10 at night, they have also taken away our weekends and holidays! Now we are working a worse shift for far less pay  then the retail Pharmacists. After many years with the company I seen it grow from a great start up company that cared about its employees to one that treats there employees like slaves! PTO does not exist as you have to sign up an year in advance to even have a shot at getting a day off. I have been on the phone with many Pharmacist's the last two nights, I can't even explain how upset they are.

review_title: Was manageable before the merger with Express Scripts but now it is all about the bottom line.
pros: Decent salary, possible work from home. Benefits are competitive.
cons: Focus has strayed from patient care to number. Forced performance rating that puts 10% at the bottom regardless of weather or not they reached their quotas and were within the limits of quality expectations.

pros: None, none, none, none, none.  Pathetic excuse for a leadership team.
cons: They eliminate much needed resources, which causes more work for the rest of us.  Leadership is dishonest, disrespectful and uncaring.  They lie to clients, employees and shareholders.  They follow none of their "express way" values, and in fact practice the opposite.  Very disappointing company to be associated with.

review_title: Proud to be an employee here
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
- Senior Leaders have taken feedback and are moving forward to make this a better place to work
- Many benefits outside of the typical health benefits are provided 
- Countless opportunities to grow personally and professionally (training)
- Room to grow and leaders willing to help you grow
cons: Large organizations often times find challenge in all of the processes getting in the way of doing the actual work.

pros: I work from home, I get paid and I have benefits. The time off accumulation is probably second best to working at home. If I was in the office I would have quit a long time ago. The first 4 yrs you get 160 hours each year of Paid Time Off and it rolls over. Probably the best part of the job.
cons:
You have to be a rock star with no life (meaning working the voluntary OT) or be the bosses favorite. Even then you aren't exempt from getting scolded. The company as a whole isn't awful but its not great. In the four years I've worked at ESI (first Accredo then Medco, now ESI) I have had 4 different supervisors because they are always changing what the think isn't working. Always moving people or coming up with new ways to "help" you collect on claims. Every company has policies in place, steps they have to follow but at ESI we are supposed to demand the insurance companies to do what we say and if we can't, we have to get our supervisor to do it for us. Its all about meeting that cash goal, that as said in other comments, is always higher and is never attainable. If we don't meet the cash goal set by upper management then we are in this hand holding match where they ask over and over "what can we do to help" but if you say anything you are passive aggressively attacked. Or condescendingly told how you are wrong. I have never felt so incompetent in any position ever. Even if you do well its "that's great but why aren't you doing it all the time". Its never enough and there's too many cooks in the kitchen trying to help or fix the issues. 

Outside of that the business process we have to follow change so often always trying to make it better or easier but really don't change it if it works. We just learn it and get used to it then it changes. Then we get reprimanded for not following the new process or policies. And you better believe that's going on your annual review. I like this motto: keep it simple stupid. This company needs to follow this more. It makes our job harder and more time consuming to have to continuously look for the newest way to do what we need to do to get a simple task done. Changing something in the system that's wrong could take months! 
I work on a specific group of insurance carriers and those patients under that insurance for any/all drugs that are sent out. Would you believe we, as in the collections department just found out we don't have contracts with not one but two insurance companies and we NEVER did! and we have been servicing patients for YEARS under these carriers. Are you kidding me?!? Now I have to tell patients they have to get theirs scripts somewhere else because we don't have a contract with those carriers so they aren't obligated to pay us. Uhm... And I'm the incompetent one? how did we not know this sooner. It happens all the time with errors that go on for years that one day someone says holy crap how are you still in business with stuff like this. I wouldn't get my scripts there but I have to or I have to pay full price elsewhere. Don't work here and don't use their service it's awful. I spend most of my days fixing mistakes we as a company made and trying to get money for it. Pure Greed should be their motto.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Plainfield, IN
pros: Good place to work if you want to also work from home with flexibility. Especially if you have  small children to care for
cons: The pay isn't that good for the work load that may be given to do. A lot of people there aren't professional at all.

review_title: prefer not to say , do no want to ID myself, professional position
job_title: Prefer Not Say in Cincinnati, OH
pros: only if you have need for a job, there are NO PROS. Even mgmt is concerned  that they are No 1 worse company to work for, having focus groups.  Why do only a superficial job in finding out the problems? why not talk to all who have been there for yrs?
cons: poor benefits (many benefits were cut for former Medco employees), including vacation time, pay for time off if out for medical leave, 100% vs 60-70%, retirement cash balance, bonuses unless you are in the upper echelons. The employees who do every day work are poorly rewarded. These employees make mgmt look good, but not rewarded.  Constant turnover of poorly trained, skilled csrs or "PCA's),  who answer the phones every day. Many sound like they flunked out of 8th grand English "no got".... Poor communication from mgmt, constant chg in SOP's, no time to read emails (not allowed if you are talking to callers), micro-management of employees, metrics-metrics, no seniority anymore (have to get up at 12Mid St Louis time 365 days in advance to request to get a day off. They advertise they have paid holidays, but the employee can not get an extra day off  during the wk if your normal day off is the paid Holiday.(no extra day); Higher paid employees pay more for health insurance to subsidize lower paid employees. (same insurance, why pay more ???)  Monitors for those on the phone, with rules changing every 1-3 mos. Employees are scored down  for petty things, esp if they do not like your voice quality. "did you say please 3x?",  did say their name 3x during the call?  They pay people for this, reward them.  If you disagree, complain--goes against. Phone quality is poor, (you have to talk to callers w/hearing challenges..what about that?), problems w/software, computers...No you do not want to work here. You will go home crying. They have also cut pay for many positions 10-25%, it shows in the quality of many employees. Many good ones are quietly leaving

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good bonuses, nice new campus, flexible work hours, freedom to work issues, good teamwork by peers, quick access to Hwy 70
cons: sweat shop, too few resources for all the work, too many levels of management, refusal to act upon employee suggestions in surveys

pros: Ability to work from home , pay rate was average for work at home but excellent for working on site , coworkers are great people and very friendly.
cons: Sitting and staring at a computer all day is very tough on the body and mind . Work at home Rph are held to a higher standard regarding quotas

review_title: The merger killed a good company (not ESI)
pros: Good PTO. Supervisors that care about their team members. Work from home in many positions.
cons: Different departments, working toward same goal, have no idea what the others are doing. No cohesion between LOBs.

pros: Formed great professional relationships over the years.  Work from home flexibility.
cons: Keep laying off skilled & long-term talent to bring in cheaper, greener recruits.   Do not value or reward professional loyalty and year-over-year good performance.  Laid off employees with 25+ years experience and proven track records.  Little career growth & opportunity, especially for NJ or non-St. Louis employees.  Uninspiring executive leadership in last few years.

job_title: Senior Accountant in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Co-workers
Work from home when necessary
Flexible work schedule 
Department team activities
cons:
Heavy workload
Too much overtime for the salary 
Promotion opportunities offered to select employees 
Poor management

pros: benefits and the other employee's.
cons: being micro-managed. They have a pay for performace program that pays you based on your phone stats. What it requires is that you rush the customers so that your average handle time is low. They do not allow you enough time to take care of the customer.

review_title: Money ain't everything!  In fact, it means very little when you're treated like crap.
pros: Salary is on the high end of market value and benefits are on the better end of most corporate gigs.
cons:
Management is horrible. Work/life balance is non existent. My direct supervisor, who had no real power, was great, but anyone director level or above is completely out of touch about the complexity of the business and systems. 

Employees are only valued with lip service. This is a Fortune 50 company and employee appreciation day consisted of watered down chili and a .39 cent mini flashlight?  I appreciate that there actually IS an employee appreciation day, but that is so cheap when the company is making record profits.  I'd rather have nothing than such a chintzy display.

I know most companies have been struggling in the recession, but ESI has not and they've been cutting jobs, benefits, increasing workloads etc as if they were in dire financial straits.  Why?  Because they can take advantage of workers in a bad economy.   I mean why eliminate casual Fridays at locations that don't really have client contact?  What is the purpose in that?  To show the employees who is boss literally.  

It was by far the worst 4 years of my professional life and I used to work in a group home where I had to brush dog crap out of someone's teeth and change people's diapers and THAT was a better job than working at ESI.  No amount of money made it worth it to stay there.

I am now at a place where I am respected and treated with dignity and have a great work/life balance. Once the economy improves, I'm sure people will leave ESI in droves until management is forced to begin treating their employees like valued human beings again in order to have any staff at all.

job_title: Account Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good peer group, the pay is good but not for the amount of hours worked.  The PTO is good but if you take time off it will take weeks to catch up.
cons: Little to no training, expected to know what you don't know, days off only set you back further, unrealistic workload expectations, frequently pointed in numerous different directions to complete tasks, no accountability, too many temporary employees.

review_title: Production is the main and only parameter that matters.
pros: Able to listen to music or audio books through head phones while working. Loose dress code policy.
cons: Production and efficiencies are more important than customer service and patient safety. Too many procedural changes taking place too quickly by people unaware of the negative and chaotic consequences.

pros: Express Scripts purchased Medco 3 years ago and have done well integrating to large companies. Culture is young, fast paced, and still growing. Company outlook is strong considering the focus on reducing healthcare costs.
cons: Current turnover is disruptive in maintaining continuity and stability. Pay and incentive package is average. Exodus of talent will require hiring of resources and promotion within.

review_title: Aggressive company with eye on financials
pros: Lots of opportunity to do different things.  Great growth potential for people with a can-do attitude and the drive to make a difference.
cons: Too many people looking to spin everything in a positive light.  An underlying reluctance to acknowledge problems and address them at their root.  Too little job security in IT.  Weak CIO.

review_title: Disenfranchised is the name of the game
job_title: Senior Management Resource Analyst in Columbus, OH
pros:
I had worked for Medco 26 years and in all of our mergers, new names, transitions, this acquisition was the worst I've ever endured. 
Major lay-offs, they didn't inform the sites until minutes before they closed. Termed RPh then found out they needed more bodies and then hired more. In one site, they closed the site, hired back some of the RPh and then closed the "site" again.
My experience - I have ALWAYS received great or fair reviews. ESI did not file my paperwork of pay grade after the acquisition. (Vacation was taken away if you had "too many") My 6 month review was great, nothing amiss. My yearly review was horrible with no warning. Instead of grading me against my peers, my prior pay grade put me in with the managers. You cannot reuse the same grade, everyone gets something different so because I was "lower" than a manger, I received the worst rating. My director said, "yes, we know it's not fair but nothing can be done about it". this made me ineligible for the bonus and a pay raise, not to mention not being able to move into another department. I was not the only one this happened to.
cons:
Management, at least in my department, berate, yell and degrade you during conference calls. Want you to speak up but then chastise you and literally call you a bully. We had witnessed that time and time again. 
Unethical practices of telling departments one thing and you know the issue is quite something else that will eliminate their job completely.

pros: There were no Pros.  Express Scripts likes to talk about patient care and how their sole interest is in offering quality care but the truth is, their sole interest are in the #'s.  Home many prescriptions/orders you mist get out in a day regardless of the quality.
cons: poorly run and poorly managed.  Have little to zero employee satisfaction and as for the staffs opinion well, they could care less.  A lot of lip service.

pros: Meaningful work in an environment that empowers leaders to grow, make decisions and drive change.  Phenomenal collection of talent with diverse backgrounds all passionately focused on serving our patients and clients.
cons: Opportunity to further differentiate the business in healthcare industry.  It is out opportunity to grab and not really a con.

pros: Great co-workers have made come good friends.
cons: Not a work life balance. Feel like a robot it's all about productivity. Always a take and  never give type atmosphere. Does not do anything to boost moral. Many people are unhappy here.

pros: Locations are pretty easy to get to
cons:
- Management won't get off employee's backs (too much micro managing)
- Too much hard work, pay does not equate to the amount of work put in
- There is no recognition from management for hard working employee's
- Executive leadership team does not care for employees, they push down on everyone else to get results they want
- There is no sense of accomplishment working for this company 

Too much to even go in to detail about.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate II in Saint Marys, GA
pros: I got a chance to meet some really cool people. Training was awesome, and they also allow you to have unpaid time off whenever the call volume was low, they call it  VTO.
cons: We were underpaid and understaffed the majority of the time. There was no room for advancement within the company.

pros: PTO is nice, VTO is offered frequently, independent working is a plus.
cons: They train you on the bare minimum of the job. The supervisors and "leads" know very little about the departments they oversee. They are more concerned with you reaching productivity goals than teaching you how to do your job well.

review_title: ESI Does not care about it's workers
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Bensalem, PA
pros: To try and help the Pt get their meds when there are issues.
cons:
Supervisors Not know the job of the employees they are supervising.
Unrealistic productivity #'s
Work "Hard & Faster" and don't make a mistake working "harder & faster" or we will fire you.
Local Management breaking. not following the Union contract unless it benefits them.

review_title: No opportunities, no trust, Senior leadership does not care
pros: The bathrooms look nice, and the lip service is right.
cons: The #2 worst place to work was mentioned in senior leadership meeting....  It was laughed off.  "Welcome to modern media!"  Company is run by an accountant, and you feel it day to day.  Much more important to make a number than do a good job.

job_title: Senior Supervisor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The best thing about working for Express Scripts was when it was still Medco. When I was an employee with Medco I thought that I was going to stay with them for the rest of my career.  however, when the merger took place and Express Scripts took over it was like watching a firing squad working its way through your colleagues.
cons: Awful pay, awful benefits and unemployment was all I got after 10 years of dedication to Medco.

review_title: Worst experience I've ever had, operationally this company is a mess!
job_title: Account Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Nice campus, centrally located, clean offices, work from home option.
cons: Express Scripts likes to pull you in, suck all of your creativity out then toss you to the dogs.  Highest turnover for a company I've ever worked for.  Senior leadership has no idea what is going on beneath them nor do they care, it's all about numbers and HR marches to a whole different drum altogether.  One of our leaders said in a management meeting they didn't care about their attrition since there is a line out the door of people "begging" to work here. It's great for Express Scripts, they can hire in 'green' workers and start them out on the lower end of the pay scale with little to no investment on their part.  I always wondered why there were so few older account managers employed by ESI, now I know why... Conceit and greed at it's finest.  You're encouraged to work as a team but then pitted against each other at evaluation time, even our directors can't figure out why this model is still in place but their feet are held to the fire just as ours.  This is not a place to begin your career. I do the best I can to encourage the many talented people I come in contact with to look elsewhere, to a company who appreciates their talents, ideas, innovations and personalities.  ESI leadership has already mentioned to us that this website (glassdoor.com) is completely bogus, inaccurate and biased when it was brought out in a management meeting.  Unfortunately, leadership chooses to discard the thoughts and opinions of their own employees as if they didn't matter.  If I was asked to discard the thoughts and opinions of my clients then I wouldn't have a job, how is this any different?  Please don't buy into the hype that ESI is a great place to work because it's a Fortune 500 company and one of the largest employers in St. Louis, at the end of the day what does that really mean, does it really matter to you or your family?

pros: Good employee benefits for health and families.
cons: Those who get ahead do so by cheating patients out of care. I got out as soon as I saw what was really happening.

review_title: Loved my job. Hated the culture after the merger.

review_title: A memory I hope to forget.

review_title: Express Scripts ruled by miser politics
pros: Multitude of pros working for Medco: generous raises, voluntary overtime, employee recognition, fair attendance policy, employee empowerment to make decisions and help patients. In the 11 years I worked for Medco, the overall work environment improved steadily. When Medco was bought out by Express Scripts in April 2012 a gradual eradication of all these positives disintegrated a work environment that even at the end of a bad day, you could rest assured the well-being of the patient came first.
cons: The stockholder is the primary concern of Express Scripts, and the corporate behavior and values exemplified does not do much to hide that. All companies need to make money yes but, when the ultimate outcome of your business affects the overall health and well-being of your customer base to have a 100% fiscally-motivated decision process is morally questionable at best. Example: Express Scripts will not cover Omeprazole, even with prior authorization, even when presented with documentation from a Dr's office that it has already proven to be the most effective therapy for a patient, simply because they find the medication cost prohibitive. With prior authorization, they will cover a less-expensive medication, that does placate some of the symptoms associated with these particular medical condition(s) but, is only partially-effective therapy.        Metrics are everything in the ESI culture, spending abnormal amounts of time extrapolating possible cost-effective measures. The emphasis on charts and percentages over customer care is disturbing.   Bottom line is they don't value their employees: my last review ( a very positive one I might add) I was informed that I would not receive a raise, as I was already paid , "35% above my market value." Exact words. No consideration that maybe I was paid over the ' market value' because I consistently performed above market value. ESI is all-encompassed by miser politics. Legacy Medco management slowly dwindle, and those that stay become more and more Stepford Wive-like.

review_title: Not a great place for those seeking a company that values employees
pros: Health benefits are pretty good.
cons:
Terrible, stressful culture: employees are miserable but reluctant to speak up about how they feel, as though the company sucks all their moral fortitude out of them.  Complete sink or swim environment; training program leaves a lot to be desired.

Regarding employee treatment, this company does not live up to its values of:
INTEGRITY - profits over people (customers and employees alike)
MUTUAL RESPECT - There's a lot of lip service, but there's no way a company is rated as the worst place to work in the country (rightfully so) if employees feel respected. I've never worked for a company I felt did not care about its employees more so than here.
PASSION - Management doesn't care whether you're passionate about work or the company, so long as you don't voice it and still work 50+ hrs a week.
ALIGNMENT and COLLABORATION - There is incredible amount of misalignment and divisiveness throughout the company: major departmental changes that impact other areas are not communicated throughout the organization; internal areas that work together are sometimes unable to contact one another as a policy; a lot of inefficiencies as a result of commonly accepted CYA and "pass the buck" practices (eg., having to verify clearly and expliicity requested information multiple times).

Outdated technology

pros:

Good Benefits
cons:
No Work-Life Balance
No Integrity from Leadership
Ludicrous Workloads 
Poor Use of Technology and Personnel
Terrible Communication Up and Down the Organziation
Culture of Pain

A friend of mine gave me some advice about job hunting a few years ago:  "Always show up to  your interview about thirty minutes early," he said.  "Watch the people walking around the building.  If more than half look miserable, walk out."

I wished I'd remembered his advice when I interviewed with this company.   From the first interview until the day I escaped I'd never seen a more sullen workplace in my two decades in IT.  It was a pit of despair.

There are multiple reasons for the morale issues:  Talented, capable engineers worked a ridiculous number of hours per week.  Putting in anything under 45 hours per week was considered slacking."  Exempt employees were treated as if the company owned all of their time.  (One of my colleagues had to call into a meeting from the Emergency Room where they'd taken a family member because our supervisor insisted that they had to be part of the call.  They didn't.)  Lip service was given to career paths and progression, but action never followed.  Training was non-existent.  Technology was outdated, and poorly-implemented.  Leadership re-organizations were constant.  (I had six bosses in four years.)  There was no real sense of job security...

I could write pages about the things I've experienced and witnessed in my four years, but that would waste my time and yours.  Bottom line:  ESI is not a company that I could recommend to my professional colleagues.  Indeed, I warned more than a few away.  Until I here otherwise from my former colleagues who are still sadly with the firm, I'll continue to do so.

review_title: IT focuses on profit not innovation or customer satisfaction

cons: Outsourcing the IT department in order to focus on IT department earnings has made it almost impossible to serve clients in a fair and competent manner. review_title: ESI: you'll be wanting to scream in frustration throughout your day.
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Tempe, AZ
pros: Initially, the work environment was encouraging and there was a sense of pride to be had in the work--that didn't last.  Management made themselves open at all hours and some managers would even provide you with their personal contact information in case of emergencies, but then they go so far as to try to 'friend' you in social media platforms with the outward intent of merely 'being friends' when they're actually using it to spy on you.
cons:
Management has a habit of lying and making up policies. It is painfully apparent that the least capable and least competent people are chosen to be managers. They have zero qualms with trying to spy on employees through social media platforms. 

Team Leads are just as bad, sometimes worse. One employee was unable to report what they felt was inappropriate behavior because one of the team leads would come to their cubicle and start playing with their hair like they were some sort of doll; it went unreported because all the managers and leads are all buddy-buddy. Absolutely disgusting. 

Management and Team Leads don't seem to have any problems cutting corners and breaking state pharmacy laws to simply "get the product out the door". Good luck trying to voice your concern, because you won't be listened to. If you attempt to persist, you become targeted as a 'problem' and you'll find yourself unable to meet any of the already crushing metrics. They will do anything to shut you up and shove you out if you voice an opinion that is even remotely not like theirs. 

Don't even think about taking a sick day; you'll either not be believed or you'll suddenly find yourself being told that you "should take FMLA". They'll claim that there is "required overtime" but then two days later they'll offer several hundred hours worth of "voluntary time off" (VTO). If you need your work week hours reduced, forget about it, because you'll just be screwed over--and once again, if you voice your opinion at all, you're targeted to be shut up and shoved out. 

Pay is insulting and pathetic for the workloads and the abuse of lower level employees being forced into working higher level queues. Low level employees are deliberately moved into higher level queues for months at a time but denied the higher level pay that goes with it. 

And for what is supposed to be a smoking-free property, there sure are a lot of fresh cigarette butts that still litter the outside seating areas and the parking lot.

review_title: ESI doesn't care one bit about it's employees OR customers, $$$ is the only thing it sees
job_title: Senior Pharmacy Technician in Columbus, OH
pros: Hard work is rewarded with reduced hours, aka "Flex", meaning that if you can achieve your numbers then you are allowed to leave early with full pay. Casual dress code. I believe that I received good compensation for my role within the company.
cons:
This company has no empathy and has demonstrated absolutely zero consideration for its employees, many of whom have been with the company for 10 or even 20+ years. My pharmacy was closed this month after years of high performance and being a leader in problem solving and handling unique queues.  Absolutely no warning was given. Everyone was simply pulled into a massive meeting and informed that the pharmacy would be closing in two weeks. Although my last day has come and gone, I still have no idea if I will be getting a severance package of any kind (although, knowing what I do of Express Scripts, I doubt it).

Beyond my issues with how this closing was handled, Express Scripts has very high expectations, the rates required to leave early are extreme and quality standards are very strict. I was allowed 1 error per approximately 300 prescriptions - anything above that warrants being put on a "step" program which is essentially probation.  There is little to no upward mobility unless you want to be a supervisor. Although steps have been taken to provide more positive reinforcement, at the end of the day negative reinforcement is what I felt in this job.

review_title: Decent Starter Job, Not A Career Developer

cons: Work/Life Balance, Management, Pay-Rates, Development & Advancement Opportunities, PTO/PST utilization system.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Franklin Lakes, NJ

I feel bad for the members...

review_title: Mostly an easy place to work

cons:

Not a lot of opportunity to grow into higher paying roles; you mostly become a cog in the machine.

review_title: Good Place to work - bad manager

cons: I was unlucky and ended up with a micro-manager and couldn't stand it and had to quit.  It could've been a dream job - I was just unlucky.

review_title: ESI is Sweatshop; Senior Management is Incompetent
pros: There are NO positives at ESI.  Senior Management (VP on up) is incompetent and they create an oppressive and toxic work environment.
cons:
The place is a sweatshop and is so inefficient with archaic and redundant processes; everything is done with Excel and PowerPoint.  Many (not all, but probably 50%) Legacy-ESI folks are down-right rude and disrespectful.  There is no growth opportunity which is evidenced by the poor tenure.  Average tenure for employees appears to be somewhere in the neighborhood of three to five years, whereas legacy-Medco average tenure was better than 10 years.

No one can make a decision.  Everything is decision by committee.  It is necessary to have a meeting to make a decision.  And you cannot just have a meeting, you must have at least several  pre-meetings.

Employee morale among legacy-Medco folks is non-existent.  We no longer have any sense of purpose, value, ownership, etc.  We know management does not value us even though we built systems that they are now moving their clients to.  Interestingly enough, after reading some of the reviews on this site, it is clear many legacy-ESI folks feel the same way.

Medical Benefits are terrible.  Premium has nearly doubled from last year and I now have a family deductible of approx. $4,000.  Time-Off policies are right out of a union shop - we no longer have an allotment of days that we can use as of 01/01; now we must accrue days before we can take time off.  Therefore, if you do not "carry" days from the previous year and you are sick the first few days of January, you will NOT get paid; your paycheck will be "short".

Staffing model (at least in IT) is 25 - 40 percent employee with the remainder made up of contingents (half of which are off-shore).  They have employees reporting to consultants and consultants making business decisions.

Is all of this what an educated tenured professional should expect?  Of course not.  It is disgraceful, and Senior Management should be embarrassed and ashamed but they are not and will not be; they simply do not care.

review_title: The worst employment experience of my career
job_title: Senior Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: salary, facilities, strong business outlook
cons: An extreme case of passive aggressive organizational culture, conflict management techniques that rival WWE farces, mid level staff management that is utterly untrustworthy and not at all above sacrificing staff to maintain their own status, a 'get it done now' work ethic that is blind to the consequences of haste and poor planning for sustainability, and tries to blame implementation teams post deployment, regardless of their guidance, and, I kid you not, the worst company coffee in St. Louis.  I am not joking.  Advancement is possible, but only through personal relationships.  Merit is not a factor, who you know and how you serve them is.  In this respect this organization takes cliques to the furthest extreme I have ever seen in my career, and I have never seen an organization with a more vindictive response to any perceived challenge or dissent voiced by any employee.

review_title: Opportunity I wanted, the support to succeed.

cons: Cultural integration needs attention after the recent merger.

cons: Pay is horrendous for the amount of work expected, standards are high and computer systems are extremely unreliable to meet the metrics. Management is unstable, not aware of the lack of professionalism of leaders on the floor.

pros: Environment was flexible and i could work at home if needed. Employee/co-workers were all top rate individuals.
